question.content: What are the official colors of FBLA?
The FBLA creed contains how many stanzas?
Who is the founder of FBLA?
What year was the first STATE chapter chartered?
The first FBLA chapter was chartered where?
What date was the first FBLA CHAPTER chartered?
What year and what group purchased the land for the FBLA-PBL National Center?
What are the three words across the top of the FBLA emblem?
In what year was Phi Beta Lambda created?
Who was the first executive director of FBLA-PBL?
Who is the Conference Director of FBLA-PBL?
Who is the Director of Membership for FBLA-PBL?
Where is the National FBLA-PBL Center located?
Who is the Education Director for FBLA-PBL?
What year was the groundbreaking for the National Center held?
What year was the Professional Division created?
In the absence of the president and vice-president at a regular meeting, who should call the meeting to order?
What symbol on the emblem denotes our belief in democracy, liberty, and the American way of life?
What body is the policy making body for national FBLA-PBL, Inc.?
What do the initials NBEA stand for?
What are the four divisions of FBLA-PBL?
question.answer: FBLA-Middle Level, FBLA, PBL, and Professional Division

question.content: How is FBLA-PBL, Inc. primarily funded?
The largest room at the National Center is the Conference room. It was a gift from what state?
What do the initials USDE stand for?
What do the initials LIFT in Mission LIFT stand for?
What is the name of the national publication for FBLA and FBLA-Middle Level members?
What is the national publication for FBLA and FBLA-Middle level advisers called?
What is the name of the publication that each local chapter receives that contains all the information about FBLA—national constitution and bylaws, national programs, national organization, etc.?
What is the national program called that encourages chapters from all divisions to team up to leverage their potential for success?
The national recognition program that recognized local FBLA chapters who either maintain or increase their local chapter membership over last year's total?
What is meant by the statement that FBLA-PBL membership is unified?
question.answer: Must be a member at local, state, and national levels

question.content: When is FBLA-PBL week?
Which officer presides over and conducts meetings according to Parliamentary Procedure?
When is a local chapter considered inactive?
question.answer: After failing to pay dues for one year

question.content: There are how many FBLA goals?
The national dues for FBLA are how much annually?
Excluding the three division presidents, what is the term of office for National Board of Director members?
Who is the FBLA-PBL Communications Coordinator?
What officer counts the votes and then records them during an election?
Who determines national dues?
Which month is National Education for Business month?
What is the official parliamentary procedure reference record for FBLA?
question.answer: Robert's Rules of Order, Newly Revised

question.content: What does the initials NASSP stand for?
question.answer: National Association of Secondary School Principals

question.content: A community service project that focuses FBLA-PBL members on practicing leadership and management skills they have learned to raise funds and awareness for the March of Dimes.
Who needs to approve a new chapter application before it is forwarded to the National office?
How many administrative regions does National FBLA-PBL have?
How long does the FBLA-PBL Board of Directors Chairman serve in that office?
What year did FBLA gain independent status?
What year was FBLA-Middle Level division established at the national level?
When is American Enterprise Day observed each year?
FBLA-PBL Week is planned every February to coincide with what other celebration?
question.answer: National Career and Technical Education Week

question.content: The national event that recognizes FBLA chapters that successfully implement a project to serve the citizens of their community.
What officer should appoint the committee chairman?
What is the national recognition program that recognizes local chapters who recruit 100% of a single course as chapter members called?
The year national FBLA-PBL membership topped the 200,000 mark for the first time?
What organization sponsored FBLA before it gained its independent status?
question.answer: National Council for Business Education (now known as National Business Education Association—FBLA)

question.content: What is the national event that recognizes FBLA chapters that successfully implement an education program to promote free enterprise?
The national program that allows FBLA members to invest a hypothetical $100,000 in NASDAQ, AMEX, and NYSE-listed common stock is called?
What is FBLA's Membership year?
What are the Five Regions of FBLA?
question.answer: Western, Mountain Plains, North Central, Southern and Eastern
